last_episode_to_air.name: Face of a Shadow
last_episode_to_air.overview: Paladin is hired by a man to deliver ten thousand dollars. When the man is found dead, with the money missing, Paladin has to sift through a numbr of suspects, including a band of gypsies and the men who found the body.

name: Have Gun, Will Travel
overview:
Have Gun – Will Travel is an American Western television series that aired on CBS from 1957 through 1963. It was rated number three or number four in the Nielsen ratings every year of its first four seasons. It was one of the few television shows to spawn a successful radio version. The radio series debuted November 23, 1958.

The television show is presently shown on the Encore-Western channel.

Have Gun – Will Travel was created by Sam Rolfe and Herb Meadow and produced by Frank Pierson, Don Ingalls, Robert Sparks, and Julian Claman. There were 225 episodes of the TV series, 24 written by Gene Roddenberry. Other contributors included Bruce Geller, Harry Julian Fink, Don Brinkley and Irving Wallace. Andrew McLaglen directed 101 episodes and 19 were directed by series star Richard Boone.

seasons.name: Season 1
seasons.overview:
The first season of Have Gun — Will Travel originally aired Saturdays at 9:30-10:00 pm on CBS from September 14, 1957 to June 14, 1958.

The Region 1 DVD was released on May 11, 2004.

seasons.name: Season 2
seasons.overview:
The second season of Have Gun – Will Travel originally aired Saturdays at 9:30-10:00 pm on CBS from September 13, 1958 to June 20, 1959.

The Region 1 DVD was released on May 10, 2005.

seasons.name: Season 3
seasons.overview:
The third season of Have Gun – Will Travel originally aired Saturdays at 9:30-10:00 pm on CBS from September 12, 1959 to June 18, 1960.

The Region 1 DVD was released on January 3, 2006.

seasons.name: Season 4
seasons.overview:
The fourth season of Have Gun – Will Travel originally aired Saturdays at 9:30-10:00 pm on CBS from September 10, 1960 to June 10, 1961.

Volume 1 of the Region 1 DVD was released on March 2, 2010. Volume 2 was released on July 6.

seasons.name: Season 5
seasons.overview:
The fifth season of Have Gun – Will Travel originally aired Saturdays at 9:30-10:00 pm on CBS from September 16, 1961 to June 2, 1962.

Volume 1 of the Region 1 DVD was released on November 30, 2010. Volume 2 was released on February 22, 2011.

seasons.name: Season 6
seasons.overview:
The sixth and final season of Have Gun – Will Travel originally aired Saturdays at 9:30-10:00 pm on CBS from September 15, 1962 to April 20, 1963.

The Region 1 DVD was released on May 7, 2013 in two volumes.

tagline: I don't think you got a very good look at this gun while you had it.

episodes.name: Three Bells to Perdido
episodes.overview: New Mexico rancher Jesse Reade hires Paladin for $1,000 to bring back outlaw Dave Enderly, who has run off to Perdido, Mexico with Reade's daughter Nancy.

episodes.name: The Outlaw
episodes.overview: Manfred Holt breaks out of jail, killing two deputies.  Is he on his way to kill the banker who testified against him, or to see his family for the last time?  The banker hires Paladin.

episodes.name: The Great Mojave Chase
episodes.overview: A sportsman sponsors a contest, betting that no one can elude his posse in the Mojave Desert.  When Paladin shows up riding a camel, the man decides that the only way he can still win is to get rid of Paladin.

episodes.name: Winchester Quarantine
episodes.overview: At a stagecoach stop, Paladin sees a peaceful Cherokee rancher being beaten by white men who think his cattle are spreading a sickness.  Paladin offers his help.

episodes.name: A Matter of Ethics
episodes.overview: An accused murderer who fears that he will be lynched before he can be returned to Bender, Wyoming, for trial, hires Paladin to make sure he gets there alive.

episodes.name: The Bride
episodes.overview: When a mail-order bride from Philadelphia gets off the stagecoach in the middle of nowhere, Paladin decides to stay with her to make sure that she is safe.

episodes.name: Strange Vendetta
episodes.overview: Paladin's new friend, stabbed by an assassin, makes a dying request to have his body taken back home to his hacienda in Mexico.

episodes.name: High Wire
episodes.overview: A hobo who was once a circus performer bets a gambler that he can walk across the saloon on a tightrope.  When Paladin sees that the gambler intends to cheat, he decides to help even the odds.

episodes.name: Show of Force
episodes.overview: After winning a batch of old rifles in a poker game, Paladin finds himself involved in a range war.

episodes.name: The Long Night
episodes.overview: A wealthy cattleman holds Paladin and two other men hostage.  They will all die at dawn unless one of them admits to the murder of the rancher's wife.

episodes.name: The Colonel and the Lady
episodes.overview: A retired colonel sends Paladin to a Nevada mining town to find out what happened to a former saloon girl.

episodes.name: No Visitors
episodes.overview: When Paladin finds a woman and her apparently typhoid-afflicted child abandoned by a wagonmaster, he enlists the aid of a female doctor from a nearby town, but a religious fanatic then tries to bar them from entry.

episodes.name: The Englishman
episodes.overview: Paladin escorts an Englishman to his female cousin's ranch they have inherited in Montana, but finds that an embittered trader is plotting against them.

episodes.name: The Yuma Treasure
episodes.overview: Accompanying a cavalry major on a mission to prevent a war by negotiating a treaty with an elusive Apache chief, Paladin must deal with soldiers who have caught gold fever.

episodes.name: The Hanging Cross
episodes.overview: On Christmas eve, an embittered rancher wants revenge on Pawnee Indians who he thinks kidnapped his son several years before.

episodes.name: Helen of Abajinian
episodes.overview: An Armenian winemaker hires Paladin to find his runaway daughter and break up her ill-considered romance with a cowhand.

episodes.name: Ella West
episodes.overview: The promoter of a wild west show asks Paladin for help taming down a very wild and famous female sharpshooter and show her how to act like a lady.

episodes.name: The Reasonable Man
episodes.overview: A rancher having a dispute with his foster son hires Paladin to keep one of them from killing the other in a duel.

episodes.name: The High-Graders
episodes.overview: When his tailor is killed in an accident at a supposedly worthless gold mine, Paladin discovers that the man was murdered and his heirs are being swindled.

episodes.name: The Last Laugh
episodes.overview: A rancher blames Paladin when a practical joke goes awry and his wife is crippled in a riding accident.

episodes.name: The Bostonian
episodes.overview: Paladin protects a new landowner from Boston, who is having an escalating feud with an established cattle rancher.

episodes.name: The Singer
episodes.overview: A cowboy seeks help for his former girlfriend, a dancehall singer, who he says was forced into marriage and is now being held prisoner.

episodes.name: Bitter Wine
episodes.overview: Paladin is hired to stop a vineyard from being ruined by seepage from an adjacent oil well.

episodes.name: Girl from Piccadilly
episodes.overview: Learning of his son's death, a rich man hires Paladin to locate the daughter-in-law he's never met, but Paladin finds two women both claiming to be her.

episodes.name: The O'Hare Story
episodes.overview: Hired to prevent the construction of a dam that would imperil a town's water supply, Paladin finds that he sympathizes more with the Irish engineer who's trying to build it.

episodes.name: Birds of a Feather
episodes.overview: Paladin must contend with other gunfighters as he tries to settle a right-of-way dispute between two railroads in a Colorado town that will die if they go elsewhere.

episodes.name: The Teacher
episodes.overview: Paladin defends a schoolmistress who's being theatened for teaching about war crimes that took place during the Civil War.

episodes.name: Killer's Widow
episodes.overview: After having killed a bank robber, Paladin is accused of having taken the stolen money.  He visits the dead man's widow and tries to make amends.

episodes.name: Gun Shy
episodes.overview: Trying to locate the thieves who stole a jade chess set, Paladin ends up in a small Montana town where he becomes involved in a romance with a landlady's daughter.

episodes.name: The Prizefight Story
episodes.overview: When Paladin goes to a mining town to promote a prizefight, his boxer is arrested and he ends up having to take the man's place in the ring -- against the Welsh champion.

episodes.name: Hey Boy's Revenge
episodes.overview: When Hey Boy's brother is killed for protesting the working conditions on a Chinese railroad gang in Utah, Paladin must get the boy out of jail and bring the killer to justice.

episodes.name: The Five Books of Owen Deaver
episodes.overview: Paladin comes to the aid of a young sheriff from the East whose attempts to keep law and order are particularly unsuitable for a cowboy town in Wyoming.

episodes.name: The Silver Queen
episodes.overview: Lonely Leadhead Kane dies and leaves his half of a mine to an actress. Kane's partner wants to challenge the will. Someone wants to make sure Paladin never gets the woman to the courtroom.

episodes.name: Three Sons
episodes.overview: Newlyweds with no place to stay end up in Paladin's suite. He learns that the groom's half-brothers are threatening to kill their father. Paladin goes to warn the father.

episodes.name: The Return of Dr. Thackeray
episodes.overview: Dr. Phyllis Thackeray diagnoses the cook at the Barton Ranch with smallpox. All the cowhands may be infected and need to be vaccinated. Dr. Thackeray sends for the one man she thinks can help.

episodes.name: 24 Hours at North Fork
episodes.overview: When a blight kills all the crops except for one farmer's, Paladin must protect him from a greedy storekeeper who wants his farm and his hired gun who has a personal grudge against Paladin.

episodes.name: Silver Convoy
episodes.overview: Paladin is hired to find James Becker. He trails him to Monterey and discovers he has been arrested and is sentenced to work in a silver mine. Paladin finds that Becker has died in a cave-in or so he is told. The owner of the mine hires Paladin to guard a silver convoy, but first Paladin wants to find out a little more about the mine.

episodes.name: Deliver the Body
episodes.overview: Paladin is hired to bring in the killer of the sheriff in a Nevada town. He brings him in but has some doubts about his guilt and decides to hang around for the trial.

episodes.name: The Statue of San Sebastian
episodes.overview: Paladin agrees to capture an outlaw in return for a statue belonging to the local mission.

1.name: Season 1
1.overview:
The first season of Have Gun — Will Travel originally aired Saturdays at 9:30-10:00 pm on CBS from September 14, 1957 to June 14, 1958.

The Region 1 DVD was released on May 11, 2004.

episodes.name: The Manhunter
episodes.overview: Paladin is forced to kill Jimmy Dawes, wanted for murder. When he takes him back to his home town, the townspeople, the sheriff and the boy's brothers give him a hostile welcome.

episodes.name: In an Evil Time
episodes.overview: Pappy French and his gang have robbed the bank in Mercede of $50,000. Pappy ran off with the cash and left his gang to shoot it out with the law. Paladin is hired to bring Pappy and the money back.

episodes.name: The Man Who Wouldn't Talk
episodes.overview: Chris Sorenson is shy around women and he asks Paladin to help him with his new neighbor, Senorita Maria de Castro, a lady rancher. Complicating the matter is cattle missing from the de Castro ranch.

episodes.name: The Hanging of Roy Carter
episodes.overview: Roy Carter is scheduled to be hanged. Another man confesses to the murder just before the execution is to take place. Paladin is hired to try to convince the warden to delay the hanging until the Governor can be reached.

episodes.name: Duel at Florence
episodes.overview: Paladin receives a letter with a bank draft for $82.17 from Ernie Teller asking for help with a matrimonial problem.

episodes.name: The Protege
episodes.overview: Paladin answers an ad in the paper by Kurt Sprague: ""Teach me to quick draw and shoot. Instruction desperately needed. Will pay one thousand dollars. Only experts need apply."" Kurt needs to learn in order to go back home. Paladin does a very good job. Only one problem: Kurt enjoys showing off his new found skill a little too much.

episodes.name: The Road to Wickenburg
episodes.overview: Paladin wakes up after being drugged, beaten and robbed in the town of Blue Bell by five men, one of whom is the town's sheriff. They took his money, gun, bullets, horse and saddle. All he has left is his two-shot derringer.

episodes.name: A Sense of Justice
episodes.overview: The sheriff of a small town needs help to prevent the lynching of simple-minded Andy Dawes. The townspeople are sure he is a murderer. Paladin offers to help

episodes.name: Young Gun
episodes.overview: An ex-gunfighter, Roy Calvert, blames the people of Benedict for his wife's death. The town is in the middle of a bad drought and Calvert and his son are blocking the only access to water in the area. Calvert has trained his son to be a gunfighter and Paladin has to face them both.

episodes.name: The Lady
episodes.overview: A British woman, Diana Coulter, hires Paladin to guide her to her brother's ranch in Shiprock, Arizona, where the Comanches are on the warpath.

episodes.name: A Snare for Murder
episodes.overview: Two ornery old gold miners, who hate each other, have struck it rich. Problem is they talk too much, and now it appears someone is trying to kill them.

episodes.name: The Ballad of Oscar Wilde
episodes.overview: Paladin is hired to protect Oscar Wilde. Another 3 men apply for the job, but after Paladin upstages them they kidnap Wilde for ransom. Paladin takes care of them, his way.

episodes.name: The Solid Gold Patrol
episodes.overview: Paladin goes to inform a calvary corporal that he has won $600,000 in a lottery. But they may not live to cash in the ticket, they are trapped by several dozen hostile Indians.

episodes.name: Something to Live For
episodes.overview: On his way to help a man and his daughter over a land dispute, Paladin encounters a wealthy, drunk and helpless man whose guide left him behind to die.

episodes.name: The Moor's Revenge
episodes.overview: Shakespearean actors are going to perform in San Diego during their roundup. They are in for a rough reception. A lovesick gunfighter is among the audience. The show's promoter hires Paladin to keep the peace.

episodes.name: The Wager
episodes.overview: Sid Morgan hires Paladin to protect him from someone who is trying to kill him. After killing the gunfighter who was following them, Paladin finds out the real reason Morgan hired him. He then hands out his own brand of justice.

episodes.name: The Taffeta Mayor
episodes.overview: John Kellaway, who is running for mayor of Colton, Wyoming, hires Paladin to protect him from his opposition. When he is killed before Paladin can get there, Paladin persuades John's widow to run for mayor.

episodes.name: Lady on the Stagecoach
episodes.overview: Paladin is traveling on a stagecoach with four others, one of whom is Della White Cloud, the educated daughter of an Apache chief. The stage is also carrying a strongbox full of gold, which Ed Rance wants.

episodes.name: Treasure Trail
episodes.overview: Paladin wins part of a treasure map in a poker game and goes in search of the treasure with three other men.

episodes.name: Juliet
episodes.overview: Juliet Harper is being hunted by the grandsons of Colonel Jeremiah Pike. Paladin meets her on the stage and now the Colonel is after both of them, and Paladin is without a gun.

episodes.name: Hunt the Man Down
episodes.overview: Paladin finds himself reluctantly drawn into a deadly dispute between two brothers who are also old aquaintances.

episodes.name: The Scorched Feather
episodes.overview: Robert Ceilbleu hires Paladin to protect his father from a Comanche war chief who has sworn to kill him. After arriving at the remote cabin of William Ceilbleu, he learns the reason for the Indian's hatred.

episodes.name: The Return of the Lady
episodes.overview: Diana Coulter (The Lady, Episode 49) wires Paladin and asks him to come to her wedding to ""give the bride away"".

episodes.name: The Monster of Moon Ridge
episodes.overview: The townspeople of Moon Ridge, Colorado believe there are monsters in the mountains. Dan Bella's daughter is taken by something and he finds strange footprints outside his daughter's window. Paladin is hired to find out what is up on the ridge.

episodes.name: The Long Hunt
episodes.overview: Thomas Orday, half Comanche, has killed two men and wounded Dundee, a former Indian fighter. He is now hiding in the mountains of New Mexico. Paladin is hired to help track him down.

episodes.name: Death of a Gunfighter
episodes.overview: A ruthless gunfighter who has killed 9 men is wanted by the townspeople, who hire Paladin. The gunfighter's brother has been hanged and left out in the sreet to trap the gunfighter. On seeing this, Paladin quits the job. The gunfighter shows up and kills all the townspeople who were gunning for him. Then he and Paladin come to an agreement that if he hangs up his guns he can go back to his hometown to marry his sweetheart. But it turns out that she has fallen in love with someone else, and more trouble ensues.

episodes.name: Incident at Borrasca Bend
episodes.overview: Arriving in a weird tent town to return money to a prospector, Paladin finds himself charged with the man's murder and tried by a kangaroo court.

episodes.name: Maggie O'Bannion
episodes.overview: After being bushwhacked and having 'everything' taken, Paladin walks to the nearest ranch and manages to get hired on as a handyman.

episodes.name: The Chase
episodes.overview: Paul Martin is a bank clerk accused of robbing the bank and killing a deputy. His wife hires Paladin to find her husband before the posse does.

episodes.name: Alaska
episodes.overview: Paladin play chess by mail with Boris, who is living in Alaska. Paladin receives what he assumes is Boris' next move but instead is a request for help. Boris is being forced out of territory he has hunted and trapped on for years. Paladin heads for Alaska to help.

episodes.name: The Man Who Lost
episodes.overview: Paladin goes after a man who murdered a man and attacked the man's wife. The victim's two brothers are also after him and don't intend to allow him to live long enough to stand trial.

episodes.name: The Return of Roy Carter
episodes.overview: Roy Carter returns to help Paladin search the snow-covered mountains for a missing chaplain and an escaped convict.

episodes.name: The Sons of Aaron Murdock
episodes.overview: Paladin becomes a bounty hunter when a rancher hires him to bring in his son, who's become a sadistic, vicious killer.

episodes.name: Comanche
episodes.overview: Corporal Henry Carver deserted from the Cavalry. Carver's mother hires Paladin to find him and get him to either return voluntarily or bring him back by force.

episodes.name: Homecoming
episodes.overview: Wrongly convicted Ed Stacy, whom Paladin helped to put in prison, is being released after being pardoned. Will Stanhope, who runs the local freight office, hires Paladin to protect him from Stacy. Paladin soon wonders who is really in danger.

episodes.name: The Fifth Man
episodes.overview: Ben Talman, who has murdered 12 men, escaped from jail. He kills four men in Yucca Bend within one week. Paladin is hired to bring him in.

episodes.name: Heritage of Anger
episodes.overview: Paladin is hired to protect the Avery family from Manuel Garcia. Garicia is a Mexican bandit who seems to have taken a special interest in their son.

episodes.name: The Haunted Trees
episodes.overview: Ben Howard is disinherited in his father's will. When his father dies, Mrs. Sarah Howard takes over running the family's  lumber company. She claims that Ben is sabotaging the work and scaring off the workers. Mrs. Howard hires Paladin to stop the problems and get rid of Ben.

episodes.name: Gold and Brimstone
episodes.overview: Paladin finds a sick old man and his son trying to protect their mine from claim jumpers. The old man is delirious and thinks that Paladin is the devil and has only offered to help in exchange for their souls.

2.name: Season 2
2.overview:
The second season of Have Gun – Will Travel originally aired Saturdays at 9:30-10:00 pm on CBS from September 13, 1958 to June 20, 1959.

The Region 1 DVD was released on May 10, 2005.

episodes.name: First, Catch a Tiger
episodes.overview: Two of the three men who brought in and helped to hang an outlaw have been killed by an assassin. The third man, Paladin, is staying at a hotel where one of the guests is the killer.

episodes.name: Episode in Laredo
episodes.overview: Kovak is reserving the entire hotel in Laredo, Texas for Sam Tuttle, a famous unbeatable gunfighter. After Paladin is forced to kill Kovak, Tuttle must challenge Paladin in order to keep his reputation in tact.

episodes.name: Les Girls
episodes.overview: Paladin is hired to deliver three mail-order brides to Bend-In-The-River.

episodes.name: The Posse
episodes.overview: Paladin stops to ask a stranger for directions and is invited to share his campsite. Later, when a posse arrives, the man announces that Paladin is the murderer they have been looking for.

episodes.name: Shot by Request
episodes.overview: Ainslee is a well-dressed, middle-aged gentleman and a reluctant gunfighter. He hires Paladin for a very strange task.

episodes.name: Pancho
episodes.overview: Mexican rancher Don Luis Ortega hires Paladin to escort his daughter across the border into the United States. However a peon from her father's ranch is determined to stop them and take her for himself.

episodes.name: Fragile
episodes.overview: Paladin is hired by the owner of ""The Frenchman's"" restaurant to take a plate glass window to the town of Panamint, a wild gold-mining town.

episodes.name: The Unforgiven
episodes.overview: Retired and wealthy General Crommer is dying. He asks Padadin, who holds an old grudge against him, to do him a favor. He asks him to take a message of forgiveness to another man who hates Crommer. A favor which might get Paladin killed.

episodes.name: The Black Handkerchief
episodes.overview: A young man convicted of murder is scheduled for execution, and Paladin attempts to intervene before it's too late.

episodes.name: The Golden Toad
episodes.overview: Paladin is drawn into a dispute between a male farmer and a female cattle rancher, with a fortune in buried treasure at stake.

episodes.name: Tiger
episodes.overview: Ellsworth believes he has had an old tiger curse put on him and that a tiger is coming to kill him. He hires Paladin to protect him from the tiger.

episodes.name: Champagne Safari
episodes.overview: An old friend of Paladin's requests his help after a family member is killed in an Indian raid.

episodes.name: Charley Red Dog
episodes.overview: The town of Santa Maria, New Mexico is in need of a new town marshal, and one man, Charley Red Dog, is out to get the job. However, he may not survive unless Paladin lends a hand.

episodes.name: The Naked Gun
episodes.overview: While in Oregon, Paladin makes a new friend, Monk, who he helps get out of a group of unruly herders.

episodes.name: One Came Back
episodes.overview: When his five-year prison term for crimes committed during the Civil War is up, Ben Harvey is eager to return to his hometown of Gila. Harvey hires Paladin to keep him protected on the way to Gila.

episodes.name: The Prophet
episodes.overview: The Army asks Paladin to find an Army colonel who disappeared with his Apache wife. There are rumors of an Army officer working with the Apaches and inciting them to war. Paladin is asked to find and stop him at all costs.

episodes.name: Day of the Badman
episodes.overview: Cynthia Palmer hires Paladin to clean up the town of Cedar Wells and get a gang out. She also wants him to send her schoolteacher nephew named Laredo back east. Paladin decides he can restore Laredo's self-respect and get rid of the gang at the same time.

episodes.name: The Pledge
episodes.overview: Ike Brennan hires Paladin to escort him through Indian country in order to exchange goods for his wife who is being held hostage by the Indians.

episodes.name: Jenny
episodes.overview: Jenny Lake goes to Paladin for help to ward off Wilson, a suitor who is pursuing her. But when Jenny disappears, Paladin must follow a trail to find her.

episodes.name: Return to Fort Benjamin
episodes.overview: Paladin is hired to help an Indian chief whose son is awaiting execution by the U.S. Army. The chief wants Paladin to bring his body back following the execution to ensure he has a proper burial. However, once Paladin makes contact with the chief's son, he begins to wonder if he's actually guilty.

episodes.name: The Night the Town Died
episodes.overview: Aaron Bell is on the warpath to bring his brother's lynchers to justice. Paladin is hired to protect a town from Bell.

episodes.name: The Ledge
episodes.overview: Richard Boone as Paladin is on the road with 4 others when a man in the distance yells to them and then falls off a ledge in an 'impossible to get to space.'  John Hoyt plays a doctor who begins to assume the man is dead, but really, everyone is unsure, and worried.  The entire episode concerns the issue of mercy killing.  Richard Rust plays a young man named Corey who is deathly afraid of heights but who tries to get down to the man to make certain.  At one point, they even feel perhaps they should shoot the man just in case he's alive.  This episode shows exactly why the show is called a psychological drama western.  It is very intense and intellectual, with superb acting.  The other two characters are a man who hides his fear by constantly laughing and a man who cannot stop saying he cannot take risks because he has a family.

episodes.name: The Lady on the Wall
episodes.overview: Paladin is accused of stealing a painting in the small town of Bonanza.

episodes.name: The Misguided Father
episodes.overview: An old friend of Paladin is shot and killed in Paladin's hotel room. After returning the body for burial, Paladin sets out to find the killer.

episodes.name: The Hatchet Man
episodes.overview: San Francisco hires Paladin to protect a Chinese detective.

episodes.name: Fight at Adobe Wells
episodes.overview: Paladin is hired to escort Jonathan Guilder through Indian country.

episodes.name: The Gladiators
episodes.overview: Allison Windrom hires Paladin to stop her father and Graham Beckley from dueling.

episodes.name: Love of a Bad Woman
episodes.overview: Tamsen Sommers is advertising for a husband, which presents a problem since she already has one. The husband hires Paladin to protect him from the men competing for the right to marry her.

episodes.name: An International Affair
episodes.overview: A Hawaiian prince is killed in Paladin's hotel room and Paladin must find out why the prince was targeted.

episodes.name: Lady with a Gun
episodes.overview: After she attempts to shoot Rudy Rossback and fails, Eve McIntosh offers Paladin $1,000 to kill him. After Paladin turns her down she hires another  gunman.

episodes.name: Never Help the Devil
episodes.overview: Doggie Kramer wins a gunfight, as the whole town he had been bullying watches, but ends up wounded. He needs Paladin to help him get out of town before the townspeople take their revenge.

episodes.name: Ambush
episodes.overview: Paladin is taking Blandings back to stand trial and stops at a ferry crossing. They are captured and held along with three others. Someone is coming and they are being held until he arrives. Each thinks it's their worst enemy coming to kill them and all they can do is wait.

episodes.name: Black Sheep
episodes.overview: Ben Huttner is a fugitive wanted for manslaughter. He is also the illegitimate son of a very wealthy man and stands to inherit his five million dollar estate, but he must first come back and stand trial. Paladin is hired to find him and either bring him back to stand trial or get him to sign a paper giving up his inheritance.

episodes.name: Full Circle
episodes.overview: A man who left Paladin to die in his place writes to Paladin and asks for his  help.

episodes.name: The Twins
episodes.overview: Adam Mirakian is wanted for a murder he claims his twin brother Sam committed. He hires Paladin to find his brother and clear his name. The only person who can tell them apart is Adam's wife, Beth.

episodes.name: The Campaign of Billy Banjo
episodes.overview: Billy Banjo, a friend of Paladin, asks Paladin to help with a fair election.

episodes.name: Ransom
episodes.overview: Paladin is hired to find Colonel Celine in order to get him to sign an important document.

episodes.name: The Trial
episodes.overview: Paladin is hired by Morgan Gibbs to bring in his son, who is wanted for murder. There is a $500 dead or alive bounty on him and Morgan offers to pay Paladin $5000 to bring him in alive. When Paladin brings him in draped over his horse, Paladin is put on trial for killing him.

episodes.name: The Search
episodes.overview: Mrs. Kilmer is dying and asks Paladin to find her missing son, Martin Kilmer. Edwards, a detective, managed to trace Martin as far as Harper City, where Edwards was then killed. Fred Harper, a half crazy man who runs Harper City, doesn't want Paladin to succeed.

3.name: Season 3
3.overview:
The third season of Have Gun – Will Travel originally aired Saturdays at 9:30-10:00 pm on CBS from September 12, 1959 to June 18, 1960.

The Region 1 DVD was released on January 3, 2006.

episodes.name: The Fatalist
episodes.overview: A Russian Jewish immigrant and his daughter are coerced by a local town boss not to testify in court about a murder.  The daughter comes to San Francisco to enlist Paladin's help.

episodes.name: Love's Young Dream
episodes.overview: Monk (The Naked Gun, Episode #92) arrives in San Francisco to collect his inheritance, a half-interest in a night club. He ends up at the Carlton Hotel to ask Paladin for help.

episodes.name: A Head of Hair
episodes.overview: An Apache indian has his eye on scalping Paladin.

episodes.name: Out at the Old Ballpark
episodes.overview: Paladin serves as umpire for a Wild West baseball game.

episodes.name: Saturday Night
episodes.overview: After being arrested along with several others for fighting in a barroom brawl, Paladin wakes up in a cell and discovers that one of the other men has been murdered.

episodes.name: The Calf
episodes.overview: When a calf is found dead, a rancher seeks revenge on another.

episodes.name: The Tender Gun
episodes.overview: During his travels, Paladin encounters a female sheriff.

episodes.name: The Shooting of Jesse May
episodes.overview: When Jesse May is shot, Paladin begins to believe that a boy murdered him.

episodes.name: The Poker Fiend
episodes.overview: A poker game takes a deadly turn and Paladin is caught in the middle.

episodes.name: Crowbait
episodes.overview: A man risks his life to be able to protect his daughter's dowry.

episodes.name: Marshal's Boy
episodes.overview: Paladin must track down a marshal's son accused of a shooting and persuade him to turn himself into the authorities.

episodes.name: Foggbound
episodes.overview: Paladin is hired to travel with adventurer Phileas Fogg during his 80 day trip around the world.

episodes.name: The Legacy
episodes.overview: After a man dies, the reading of his will causes three additional murders.

episodes.name: The Prisoner
episodes.overview: Paladin is hired by a man who has been wrongly accused of murder.

guest_stars.character: Samuels - Bureau of Territorial Records Rep
guest_stars.name: Peter Brocco

episodes.name: The Mountebank
episodes.overview: A puppeteer gives Paladin a wagon ride to an Army fort commanded by a general with presidential aspirations.

episodes.name: The Sanctuary
episodes.overview: Coming off the trail, Paladin pulls into a mission seeking a night's rest and ends up helping a man running from a lynch mob.

episodes.name: A Quiet Night in Town (1)
episodes.overview: Paladin arrives in the Texas border town of Jody with a murder suspect named Joselito Kincaid. Their appearance creates tension: this is cow country, and Kincaid is a sheepherder. (Part 1 of 2)

episodes.name: A Quiet Night in Town (2)
episodes.overview: When a group of men kill Paladin's prisoner, Paladin must bring the group of murders to justice. (Part 2 of 2)

episodes.name: The Princess and the Gunfighter
episodes.overview: Paladin is hired to find the princess of a tiny kingdom who disappeared while making a United States tour.

episodes.name: Shadow of a Man
episodes.overview: Paladin is hired by the wife of a weak man who's terrorized by his hometown. The Southerner is hated because of his role in the Lincoln assassination.

episodes.name: Long Way Home
episodes.overview: The hunter becomes the hunted. When Paladin captures a former slave turned outlaw, a gang of rough bounty hunters fight to take his prisoner, dead or alive. When Paladin is bitten by a rattlesnake, the outlaw has to choose between saving him and saving himself.

episodes.name: The Taxgatherer
episodes.overview: Have gun - will collect taxes. Paladin teams up with a powerful rancher to collect taxes from some of the roughest cattle-rustlers in the West. But how will he get the money when the man he's riding with has vowed never to pay a cent?

episodes.name: The Fatal Flaw
episodes.overview: Stranded in a mountain cabin during a snowstorm, a sinister, Satan-worshipping outlaw bets Paladin he can do the unthinkable: corrupt the soul of an honest lawman.

episodes.name: Fandango
episodes.overview: As a favor to an old friend, Paladin captures two teenagers sentenced to hang. Then, he finds himself face-to-face with an old gunfighter who wants the pleasure of hanging the boys who killed his brother. In the end, Paladin wonders how young is too young to be responsible for your crime.

episodes.name: The Last Judgement
episodes.overview: Arriving in a small Arkansas town Paladin finds Dr. Simeon Loving chained in the street. He is charged with murder and Paladin is pressured into serving as his defense attorney. Elroy Greenleaf, a self-appointed justice of the peace, has decided that Loving will hang unless Paladin can persuade the jury to oppose Greenleaf.

episodes.name: The Gold Bar
episodes.overview: Paladin tries to help a timid bank clerk return the gold he stole from his employer before it's discovered missing.

episodes.name: Everyman
episodes.overview: A fortune teller predicts trouble for Paladin in the extremely near future.

episodes.name: The Siege
episodes.overview: A desert town hires Paladin to deal with three brothers who have been poisoning the municipal water supply.

episodes.name: The Long Weekend
episodes.overview: Paladin is hired to protect a town from a mountain man who occasionally wreaks havoc there.

episodes.name: El Paso Stage
episodes.overview: Paladin decides to end the reign of terror of a psychotic town marshal.

episodes.name: Duke of Texas
episodes.overview: Franz, a young Austrian Duke, hires Paladin to guide him to meet with a general who has promised to help reclaim Mexico for the Austrian empire. Franz believes the people of Mexico will welcome him, but Padadin thinks that Franz's advisor has other reasons for making the trip.

episodes.name: Broken Image
episodes.overview: Paladin and a local hero go in pursuit of a gang of bank robbers but the hero may not be what he seems.

episodes.name: Brother's Keeper
episodes.overview: After being attacked by a puma in the wild, things go from bad to awful for Paladin when he's robbed and left for dead by two men.

episodes.name: Bearbait
episodes.overview: Paladin becomes involved when a timid sheriff refuses to do anything about three young hooligans who are terrorizing a town.

episodes.name: The Cure
episodes.overview: Paladin helps down on her luck Calamity Jane regain her mojo.

episodes.name: The Road
episodes.overview: Paladin is robbed by scavengers and then forced to cross the mountain in winter without his horse, guns or coat.

episodes.name: The Uneasy Grave
episodes.overview: After encountering a woman burying her fiancee in an unmarked grave, Paladin is persuaded to go after the deceased's killer.

episodes.name: Soledad Crossing
episodes.overview: A diptheria scare slows the return of Paladin's prisoner to justice.

4.name: Season 4
4.overview:
The fourth season of Have Gun – Will Travel originally aired Saturdays at 9:30-10:00 pm on CBS from September 10, 1960 to June 10, 1961.

Volume 1 of the Region 1 DVD was released on March 2, 2010. Volume 2 was released on July 6.

episodes.name: The Piano
episodes.overview: European pianist Franz Lister comes to the United States to give a concert for Mona Lansing, a former saloon hostess. When Lister's piano is stolen, Mona hires Paladin to get it back.

episodes.name: Ben Jalisco
episodes.overview: Escaped killer, Ben Jalisco, is a ruthless hunter who has murdered more than 30 men. Now he is after his wife, Lucy, who informed on him and Paladin, who brought him in.

episodes.name: A Drop of Blood
episodes.overview: Paladin is invited to best man at Rivka Shotness' wedding. When he arrives he finds that Billy Buckstone, the man the bride's family helped to convict, has been freed from prison and is on his way back.

episodes.name: A Knight to Remember
episodes.overview: Paladin is hired to find Don Esteban, who has disappeared. When he finds him he is dressed as a knight in armor and thinks he is Don Quixote.

episodes.name: Squatter's Rights
episodes.overview: Costigan is a land owner and cattleman. He was shot by Clemenceau, a squatter on his land. Paladin has offered to help him get rid of the squatter but doesn't approve of his methods.

episodes.name: Mark of Cain
episodes.overview: Dr. Avatar hires Paladin to guide him to Jack Trueblood, a notorious western badman who has killed many men. Avatar wants to measure Trueblood's head to confirm his research on cranial measurements.

episodes.name: One, Two, Three
episodes.overview: Samuel Keel hires Paladin to find Seth Carter. Keel gives him the names of three people who can help him find Seth. As Paladin finds them, each is murdered. Paladin is determined to find out why.

episodes.name: The Man Who Struck Moonshine
episodes.overview: Moses Kadish is an alcoholic. He moves to middle of nowhere to try to stop drinking and drills a well. The well produces whiskey instead of water.

episodes.name: Jonah
episodes.overview: $20,000 in gold bullion is stolen and dropped into a lake. Paladin decides to try to retrieve it but Jonah, a fisherman, has the spot staked out. He's after a huge trout and doesn't want anyone getting in his way. There's also the three thieves watching and waiting to ambush Paladin once he gets the gold.

5.name: Season 5
5.overview:
The fifth season of Have Gun – Will Travel originally aired Saturdays at 9:30-10:00 pm on CBS from September 16, 1961 to June 2, 1962.

Volume 1 of the Region 1 DVD was released on November 30, 2010. Volume 2 was released on February 22, 2011.

episodes.name: Genesis
episodes.overview: After an unsuccessful attempt on his life by young Roderick Jefferson, Paladin is prompted into remembering a similar incident from his past.  Once, as a youth, he agreed to pay off a gambling debt by shooting it out with a professional gunfighter.

episodes.name: Beau Geste
episodes.overview: After 15 years in office, Sheriff Dobbs is retiring and some old enemies are just waiting for the day he turns in his badge. Paladin received a newspaper clipping about the sheriff and $10 to save Dobbs' life.

episodes.name: Marshal of Sweetwater
episodes.overview: Sweetwater was a wild town before Thomas Carey, a retired Army scout and old friend of Paladin, became marshal. But Carey has taken over complete control and turned into a killer. Paladin has to stop him and Carey has always seemed the faster of the two.

episodes.name: The Eve of St. Elmo
episodes.overview: Colonel Draco invites Paladin to investigate  an "insurrection" over water rights.  Paladin discovers that Draco was crippled eight months previously and wants revenge.  Paladin has no intention of being Draco's  executioner.

episodes.name: Lady of the Fifth Moon
episodes.overview: Paladin comes to pay his respects to the  mother of a Chinese man who is killed. She asks Paladin to meet a ship bound for China and see that her granddaughter is brought safely aboard.

episodes.name: Two Plus One
episodes.overview: Paladin is riding to meet a lovely French lady in Los Angelos. On the way he encounters an Indian maiden being attacked. The girl, Taymanee, after being rescued, informs Paladin that she now belongs to him. His tryst takes a bad turn  when Taymanee's attackers return.

episodes.name: The Black Bull
episodes.overview: After being tortured, Paladin, becomes a surrogate bull for a famous, but now insane bullfighter,  Nino Ybarra..

episodes.name: Face of a Shadow
episodes.overview: Paladin is hired by a man to deliver ten thousand dollars. When the man is found dead, with the money missing, Paladin has to sift through a numbr of suspects, including a band of gypsies and the men who found the body.

6.name: Season 6
6.overview:
The sixth and final season of Have Gun – Will Travel originally aired Saturdays at 9:30-10:00 pm on CBS from September 15, 1962 to April 20, 1963.

The Region 1 DVD was released on May 7, 2013 in two volumes.
